review: Since I already have and Apple TV, I wasn't really in the market to buy another digital streaming device. But when I heard about the Sling TV deal that let you get one of these Fire TV Sticks free with a 3 month Sling subscription, and because I wanted to try out Sling anyway, I thought, "Why not?"I have to say that I'm more impressed than I expected to be with the Fire TV Stick. The user interface is, in my opinion, much better than the Apple TV's. Also, I like the flexibility of being able to install apps to customize what the Fire TV Stick can offer.It is, of course, very geared toward pushing Amazon digital content, but that's okay since we do watch some Prime Videos and because I have a lot of my music available through Amazon Music since much of it was purchased through Amazon. The ability to play these through the TV without using AirPlay is nice. Playback of both video and audio has been very good for me. I'm looking forward to the update that's been announced that will allow more options with Amazon Music.I haven't done anything with games on the Fire TV Stick. It seems like with gaming consoles, computers, and portable devices, we have more than enough gaming options in our house, so we haven't used the Fire TV Stick that way yet.There are some rumors about forthcoming improvements in the Apple TV (including apps and streaming TV services) that may cause me to switch back to Apple TV, but for now, the Fire TV Stick is getting some good use.
